Facility Supervisor Job at Devien Consult Limited




        
    

        
        Devien Consult Limited is a human resources consulting firm that is dedicated to providing innovative and effective HR solutions to businesses of all sizes.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Supervisor

Job Location: Lekki Conservation Road, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Real Estate

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a responsible and detail-oriented Facility Supervisor to oversee the daily operations, maintenance, and overall condition of a residential apartment facility.
	The role involves ensuring the property is safe, functional, and well-maintained while coordinating service providers and internal staff.


Job Responsibilities


	Supervise day-to-day facility operations and maintenance activities.
	Ensure proper functioning of electrical, plumbing, and general building systems.
	Coordinate and monitor technicians, vendors, and service providers.
	Conduct routine facility inspections and report faults promptly.
	Ensure cleanliness, safety, and compliance with basic facility standards.
	Maintain records of maintenance activities and inventory.
	Respond to facility-related issues and emergencies as they arise.


Job Requirements


	Minimum of OND / HND qualification or equivalent qualification in Facilities Management, Engineering, or a related field.
	Proven experience in facility or property supervision (experience in residential apartments is an advantage).
	Basic knowledge of building maintenance, electrical, and plumbing systems.
	Strong supervision, coordination, and problem-solving skills.
	Good communication and reporting skills.
	Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks.


Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Project Manager - Mechanical Engineering & PLP Job at Coca-Cola Hellenic Bottling Company




        
    

        
        Coca-Cola HBC (Coca-Cola Hellenic Bottling Company) is a bottling partner of The Coca-Cola Company. Coca-Cola HBC is headquartered in Zug, Switzerland and has a premium listing on the London Stock Exchange and secondary listing on the Athens Exchange. The Coca-Cola Company is the world's largest beverage company and operates in more than 200 countries.

Life at Coca-Cola HBC is fast-paced and challenging, with fair rewards and exciting learning opportunities. We promote an inclusive workplace, value diverse views and opinions and always appoint the best person for the job, ensuring equality in our shortlists and appointments. Take up the challenge. Join us!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Project Manager - Mechanical Engineering & PLP

Job Location: Lagos

About the Role


	Project Manager-Mechanical Engineering & PLP holds the knowledge on initiating, planning, execution, monitoring & closure of all Mechanical & PLP engineering projects.
	He/she is primarily responsible for preparation of scope of works, cost & resources management, development of design and details for execution and daily follow up on timelines, compliance to engineering & PLP standards, quality of work and occupational health and safety on work sites.


Key Responsibilities


	Responsible for evaluating Mechanical Engineering (Media piping & Heat Ventilation & Air Conditioning) and Property Loss Prevention project scope for respective capital expenditures.
	Assess and allocate resources effectively for the operation and enhancement of ventilation and firefighting system for facility upgrades.
	Disseminate best practices to on-site mechanical engineering project site engineers in the supervision of varying contractors and projects towards achieving project's cost, timeline and quality objectives.
	Engage with consultants and industry experts on diverse media supplies for production and utility equipment, facilitating the implementation of detailed piping and instrumentation designs.
	Drive implementation of Mechanical Engineering & PLP project QC/QA on sites.
	Lead the execution of perform injection projects, including collaboration with OEM, Plant and Group Engineering teams on project development.
	Initiate request for approval for property loss prevention capital investments according to annual business plan.
	Perform valuations on on-going Mechanical engineering & PLP projects for payments to vendors on time and accurately
	Timely capitalization of constructed and installed new assets.
	Build knowledge on complex Mechanical & PLP projects.
	Build system knowledge in CCHBC manufacturing operations.
	Develop end user capabilities in Fire protection infrastructures by initiating OEM and expert level training.


Requirements


	Have a BSc / HND in Mechanical Engineering or any other related field.
	Have at least 7 years of experience as a Project Manager- Mechanical Engineering & PLP or similar role.
	Proven technical experience is mandatory
	Professional certifications is an added advantage.
	SAP knowledge an added advantage
	Effective use of AutoCAD, Structural design (manual & Soft tools), MS Project, MS Office Suite.
	Have knowledge on complex Mechanical & PLP projects.
